additionalTextInformation.text:
A series of portraits depicting noble men by the monogrammist IS. These paintings were without doubt originally conceived as a series. This theory is supported by various visual clues, including their similar dimensions and uniform backgrounds. In addition all the sitters are shown as half-length figures in three quarter profile with their hands positioned in front of their bodies. Six of the portraits are signed with the monogram IS. The series was probably created about 1560. 
[Teget-Welz 2018, 210]

pageContext.description: Bust-length portrait of Johann Ernst I, Duke of Saxony-Coburg (1521-1553) against a blue background, facing to the left.

metadata.title: Duke Johann Ernst I. of Saxony-Coburg

pageContext.provenance:
- this painting is one of a series originally from Gotha and belonged to the original art cabinet established by Duke Ernst the Pious, the patriarch of the Ernestine Saxony-Gotha family line and ordered that Friedenstein castle be built 
- an inventory from 1638 lists the paintings in the lower salon of the residency in Weimar 
- 1644 listed in the 'Taffelstuben' of the 'Gothaer Kaufhaus'
- 1656 listed in the earliest surviving inventory from Friedenstein castle 'Inventarium über die Kunst Cammer'
- removed from Friedenstein castle sometime between 1856 and 1876; the painting was last recorded in Gotha in Georg Rathgeber's 'Beschreibung der Herzoglichen Gemälde-Gallerie zu Gotha [...]' [1835] as part of a series then consisting of 27 portraits 
[Teget-Welz 2018, 210, 211]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
Support:
- the horizontal battens have been removed, but traces of the glue are still visible 
Paint layers:
- the surface exhibits a fine craquelé; areas of the fur-trimming are abraded 
- the exit holes and losses along the bottom edge have been filled and retouched (particularly in the hands and the right corner) 
- abrasion caused by the frame along the edges 
Varnish:
- the varnish on the open join at the top, the right shoulder and in the area of filled and retouched exit holes has been thinned. 
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 166]

tests.text:
- lime wood
- two vertically aligned and butt-joined planks. Plank I: 18.2 cm; plank II: 18.2 cm. At the top and bottom the planks are joined with dovetail inserts. All four edges are grooved and there is no indication that they were sloped. The horizontal battens have been removed, but traces of the glue is still visible. Along the top and bottom edges traces of the chalk ground are visible, particularly on the reverse at the right.

pageContext.signature:
Monogram at the left edge above the sitter's sleeve: 'IS' (linked)
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 166]
